archimate:Requirement.name: SOGP Stub
archimate:Requirement.documentation:
This is an example of an SOGP Stub. This element only purpose is to aid explaining the modelling structure in the view where it has been placed. An SOGP Stub may be realized by one or more Control Measures or in worst case, none at all.
A Stub is the top part of a statement. Its numbering format is two letters, followed by three numbers separated by dots. This is an example of an SOGP Stub. This element's only purpose is to aid in explaining the modeling structure in the view where it has been placed. An SOGP Stub may be realized by one or more Control Measures or, in some cases, none at all. The number of Sub-Points in a Stub varies.
Essentially, a Stub is equivalent to a Statement but with added detail due to the Sub-Points. Its numbering format is two letters, followed by three numbers separated by dots.
